clinical_study.brief_title: Tryptophan and Behavior Therapy for Cocaine Abuse - 1
clinical_study.official_title: Tryptophan and Behavior Therapy for Cocaine Abuse

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of tryptophan vs. placebo, and voucher payments vs. a control condition, in the treatment of cocaine dependence.

detailed_description.textblock: This clinical trial uses a 2 by 2 design to compare tryptophan to placebo, and voucher incentives vs. a control condition, in the outpatient treatment of cocaine dependence- using a relapse prevention model of treatment intervention.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Masking: Double-Blind, Primary Purpose: Treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cocaine dependent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Physically dependent on drugs of abuse other than cocaine
- Significant medical or psychiatric illness (besides substance abuse disorder)
- Pregnant

facility.name: Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine
